title: Business Plan Review
description: Comprehensive analysis of a client's business plan with actionable feedback
prompt:
You are an experienced SBDC business advisor. Please review the following business plan for [CLIENT FIRST NAME]'s [BUSINESS TYPE] business.

Business Plan Summary:
[PASTE BUSINESS PLAN OR KEY SECTIONS HERE]

Please provide:
1. Executive Summary Assessment - Is it compelling and complete?
2. Market Analysis Feedback - Are the target market and competition well-defined?
3. Financial Projections Review - Are assumptions realistic?
4. Operational Plan Gaps - What's missing or needs strengthening?
5. Top 3 Strengths of this plan
6. Top 3 Areas for Improvement with specific suggestions
7. Questions I should ask the client in our next session

Format your response in clear sections that I can share with my client.

body.c: You are an experienced SBDC business advisor. Please review the following business plan for

body.label: Business Plan Document
body.hint: Drop a PDF or Word document

body.label: Paste Business Plan
body.ph: Paste the business plan or key sections here...
body.tip: Copy and paste the plan text

body.c:
Please provide:
1. Executive Summary Assessment — Is it compelling and complete?
2. Market Analysis Feedback — Are the target market and competition well-defined?
3. Financial Projections Review — Are assumptions realistic?
4. Operational Plan Gaps — What's missing or needs strengthening?
5. Top 3 Strengths of this plan
6. Top 3 Areas for Improvement with specific suggestions
7. Questions I should ask the client in our next session

Format your response in clear sections that I can share with my client.

title: Cash Flow Analysis
description: Help clients understand and improve their cash flow management
prompt:
I'm advising a small business client on cash flow management. Here's their situation:

Business: [BUSINESS NAME] - [INDUSTRY/TYPE]
Monthly Revenue: [AMOUNT]
Key Expenses: [LIST MAJOR EXPENSES]
Current Challenge: [DESCRIBE CASH FLOW ISSUE]

Please help me:
1. Identify potential cash flow red flags based on this information
2. Suggest 5-7 specific strategies to improve their cash flow
3. Create a simple cash flow talking points list I can use in our advising session
4. Recommend metrics they should track monthly
5. Suggest questions I should ask to better understand their situation

Keep recommendations practical for a small business owner without a finance background.

title: Market Research Kickstart
description: Guide clients through market and competitive analysis
prompt:
I'm helping an SBDC client conduct market research for their [NEW/EXISTING] business.

Business Concept: [DESCRIBE THE BUSINESS]
Target Location: [CITY/REGION]
Proposed Target Customer: [CUSTOMER DESCRIPTION]
Main Products/Services: [LIST OFFERINGS]

Please provide:
1. Key market research questions they should answer
2. Free or low-cost resources for finding market data in this industry
3. A simple competitive analysis framework they can complete
4. 5 questions to ask potential customers for validation
5. Red flags or assumptions they should test before proceeding
6. A suggested 2-week market research action plan

Make this actionable for a first-time entrepreneur.

title: SWOT Analysis Facilitator
description: Structured session guide for facilitating client SWOT meetings
prompt:
Help me facilitate a SWOT analysis session with my SBDC client.

Business: [BUSINESS NAME]
Industry: [INDUSTRY]
Years in Operation: [NUMBER] years
Current Situation: [BRIEF CONTEXT - e.g., "considering expansion" or "facing new competition"]

Based on this context, please:
1. Suggest 5 probing questions for each SWOT category that I can ask the client
2. Provide industry-relevant examples for each category to spark their thinking
3. Create a framework for prioritizing the findings
4. Suggest how to turn this SWOT into 3-5 strategic action items
5. Give me a suggested agenda for a 60-minute SWOT session

Format as a facilitator's guide I can reference during the meeting.

title: Funding Readiness Assessment
description: Evaluate if a client is ready to seek financing
prompt:
I'm assessing whether my SBDC client is ready to seek [LOAN/INVESTMENT/GRANT] funding.

Business: [BUSINESS NAME]
Industry: [INDUSTRY]
Time in Business: [DURATION]
Funding Amount Sought: [AMOUNT]
Intended Use of Funds: [PURPOSE]
Current Annual Revenue: [REVENUE]
Credit Score Range: [RANGE if known]

Please provide:
1. A readiness checklist - what documents and metrics should they have prepared?
2. Likely lender/investor questions they should be ready to answer
3. Red flags that might hurt their application
4. Steps to improve their fundability if not ready
5. Suggested funding sources appropriate for their profile
6. Timeline expectations for different funding types

Help me give them realistic expectations and a clear path forward.

body.c: I'm assessing whether my SBDC client is ready to seek

body.label: Funding Type
body.tip: Select or type a funding type

body.label: Purpose
body.tip: What the funds will be used for

body.c:
Please provide:
1. A readiness checklist — what documents and metrics should they have prepared?
2. Likely lender/investor questions they should be ready to answer
3. Red flags that might hurt their application
4. Steps to improve their fundability if not ready
5. Suggested funding sources appropriate for their profile
6. Timeline expectations for different funding types

Help me give them realistic expectations and a clear path forward.

title: Resource Recommendations
description: Match clients with appropriate resources and referrals
prompt:
Help me identify the best resources and referrals for my SBDC client.

Client Need: [PRIMARY CHALLENGE OR GOAL]
Business Stage: [IDEA/STARTUP/GROWTH/ESTABLISHED]
Industry: [INDUSTRY]
Location: [CITY/STATE]
Budget for Services: [RANGE OR "LIMITED"]
Specific Constraints: [ANY LIMITATIONS - time, language, accessibility, etc.]

Already Tried/Using:
- [EXISTING RESOURCES]

Please suggest:
1. Free resources (government, nonprofit, online)
2. Low-cost options (workshops, programs, tools)
3. Professional referrals that might be needed (accountant, attorney, etc.)
4. Industry-specific resources
5. Funding programs they might qualify for
6. Peer networks or mentorship opportunities
7. Online tools and templates

For each, briefly explain why it's relevant to their situation.

title: Impact Narrative Writer
description: Transform client outcomes into compelling impact stories
prompt:
Help me write an impact narrative for SBDC reporting purposes.

Client Business: [BUSINESS NAME]
Industry: [INDUSTRY]
Services Provided: [LIST SBDC SERVICES - e.g., business planning, financial analysis, marketing strategy]
Advising Hours: [NUMBER] hours over [TIMEFRAME]

Outcomes Achieved:
- [OUTCOME 1 - e.g., "Secured $50,000 SBA loan"]
- [OUTCOME 2 - e.g., "Hired 3 new employees"]
- [OUTCOME 3 - e.g., "Increased revenue by 25%"]

Client Quote (if available): "[QUOTE]"

Please write:
1. A 100-word impact summary suitable for reports
2. A 250-word success story for newsletters/marketing
3. Key metrics to highlight
4. A compelling headline for this story

Use professional tone appropriate for SBA reporting while making the human impact clear.

title: Session Notes Formatter
description: Convert rough notes into structured CRM documentation
prompt:
Please help me format my SBDC client session notes for our CRM system.

Raw Notes from Session:
[PASTE YOUR ROUGH NOTES HERE]

Client: [CLIENT FIRST NAME]
Business: [BUSINESS NAME]
Date: [DATE]
Session Type: [IN-PERSON/VIRTUAL/PHONE]
Duration: [LENGTH]

Please organize into:
1. Session Summary (2-3 sentences)
2. Topics Discussed (bullet points)
3. Advice/Recommendations Given
4. Action Items for Client (with suggested deadlines)
5. Follow-up Items for Advisor
6. Next Session Focus Areas
7. Milestones to Track

Keep the language professional but concise for database entry.

title: Quarterly Report Draft
description: Generate quarterly performance report content
prompt:
Help me draft content for our SBDC quarterly report.

Reporting Period: [Q1/Q2/Q3/Q4] [YEAR]
Center Name: [SBDC CENTER NAME]

Key Metrics This Quarter:
- Clients Served: [NUMBER]
- Advising Hours: [NUMBER]
- Training Attendees: [NUMBER]
- Businesses Started: [NUMBER]
- Jobs Created: [NUMBER]
- Capital Infusion: $[AMOUNT]

Notable Achievements:
[LIST 3-5 HIGHLIGHTS]

Challenges Faced:
[LIST ANY CHALLENGES]

Please generate:
1. Executive summary paragraph (100 words)
2. Metrics analysis with context (what do these numbers mean?)
3. 3 spotlight stories structure based on achievements
4. Goals/outlook for next quarter
5. Resource needs or support requests language

Match the professional tone expected in SBA reporting.

title: Milestone Tracking Summary
description: Create client milestone reports for tracking and reporting
prompt:
Help me create a milestone tracking summary for an SBDC client.

Client: [CLIENT FIRST NAME]
Business: [BUSINESS NAME]
Engagement Start Date: [DATE]
Primary Goal: [MAIN OBJECTIVE - e.g., "Launch business" or "Secure funding"]

Milestones Completed:
- [DATE]: [MILESTONE 1]
- [DATE]: [MILESTONE 2]
- [DATE]: [MILESTONE 3]

In Progress:
- [CURRENT MILESTONE]

Please create:
1. A timeline visualization description
2. Progress summary paragraph for reporting
3. Estimated completion path for remaining goals
4. Risk factors or blockers to note
5. Recommended next milestones to set

Format for both internal tracking and potential inclusion in impact reports.

title: Email Follow-up Templates
description: Professional follow-up emails for various client situations
prompt:
Generate professional SBDC advisor email templates for the following scenario:

Scenario: [CHOOSE ONE]
- Post-session follow-up
- Checking in after no contact for [X] weeks
- Congratulating on milestone achieved
- Reminder about upcoming deadline
- Request for outcome data/metrics
- Referral to another resource/partner

Client Name: [NAME]
Business: [BUSINESS NAME]
Specific Context: [ANY RELEVANT DETAILS]

Please provide:
1. Subject line options (3)
2. Email body (professional but warm tone)
3. Clear call-to-action
4. Shorter alternative version for quick sends

Keep SBDC's supportive, professional voice throughout.

title: New Advisor Orientation
description: Onboarding content for new SBDC advisors
prompt:
Help me create orientation content for a new SBDC business advisor.

New Advisor Background: [INDUSTRY EXPERIENCE/EXPERTISE AREAS]
Center Focus Areas: [YOUR CENTER'S SPECIALTIES]
Client Base Description: [TYPICAL CLIENT PROFILE]

Please generate:
1. "First 30 Days" checklist with key learning priorities
2. Overview of core SBDC services they'll be providing
3. Common client scenarios they'll encounter with suggested approaches
4. Key metrics and reporting requirements to understand
5. Professional development resources for business advising
6. Tips for effective client intake conversations
7. Do's and Don'ts from experienced advisors

Make this practical and immediately useful for someone new to SBDC work.

title: Advising Best Practices
description: Training content on effective advising techniques
prompt:
Create a best practices refresher for SBDC business advisors on effective advising.

Focus Area: [CHOOSE OR SPECIFY]
- Active listening techniques
- Asking powerful questions
- Delivering difficult feedback
- Setting appropriate boundaries
- Managing client expectations
- Cultural competency in advising
- Virtual advising effectiveness

Experience Level: [NEW/EXPERIENCED] advisors
Session Length: [TIME] for training

Please provide:
1. Key principles with brief explanations
2. Common mistakes to avoid
3. Practical techniques with examples
4. Role-play scenarios for practice
5. Self-assessment questions
6. Resources for deeper learning

Format as a training facilitator guide or self-study resource.

title: Difficult Conversation Prep
description: Prepare for challenging client conversations
prompt:
Help me prepare for a difficult conversation with an SBDC client.

Situation: [DESCRIBE THE CHALLENGE]
Examples:
- Client's business idea isn't viable
- Client isn't following through on commitments
- Need to deliver negative news about funding denial
- Client has unrealistic expectations
- Addressing a failing business situation

Client Context: [RELEVANT BACKGROUND]
Relationship History: [BRIEF DESCRIPTION]
Desired Outcome: [WHAT YOU HOPE TO ACHIEVE]

Please provide:
1. Key talking points and how to frame them
2. Phrases to use (and avoid)
3. Anticipated client reactions and responses
4. How to maintain the advising relationship
5. Follow-up plan regardless of how it goes
6. Self-care reminders for the advisor

Keep the approach empathetic but professionally honest.

title: Workshop Curriculum Builder
description: Design engaging SBDC training workshops
prompt:
Help me design an SBDC workshop/training session.

Topic: [WORKSHOP TOPIC]
Target Audience: [WHO WILL ATTEND - e.g., "aspiring entrepreneurs" or "existing business owners"]
Duration: [LENGTH - e.g., "2 hours" or "half-day"]
Format: [IN-PERSON/VIRTUAL/HYBRID]
Expected Attendance: [NUMBER]

Learning Objectives (what should they know/do after?):
1. [OBJECTIVE 1]
2. [OBJECTIVE 2]
3. [OBJECTIVE 3]

Please create:
1. Session outline with timing
2. Engaging opening activity
3. Key content sections with delivery notes
4. Interactive elements/exercises
5. Handout or takeaway content outline
6. Q&A facilitation tips
7. Follow-up resources to share
8. Evaluation questions to assess effectiveness

Make it engaging and practical, not lecture-heavy.

title: AI Search Visibility Optimizer
description: Optimize content and brand presence for AI search engines like ChatGPT, Claude, and Perplexity
prompt:
You are an AI search optimization strategist and AEO (AI Engine Optimization) expert who specializes in optimizing content and brand presence for AI search engines like ChatGPT, Claude, Perplexity, and Google's AI Overview.

# CONTEXT
I need to optimize our content strategy and brand presence for AI search engines, ensuring our brand gets mentioned and cited when potential customers ask AI tools questions related to our industry.

# CURRENT CONTENT STATE
- Website content: [YOUR CURRENT WEBSITE CONTENT AND STRUCTURE]
- Blog content: [YOUR BLOG CONTENT TOPICS AND DEPTH]
- Resource library: [GUIDES, WHITEPAPERS, CASE STUDIES, ETC.]
- Current SEO performance: [CURRENT GOOGLE SEARCH PERFORMANCE]

# TARGET QUERIES
- Customer problem queries: [QUESTIONS CUSTOMERS ASK ABOUT PROBLEMS YOU SOLVE]
- Solution research queries: [QUESTIONS ABOUT SOLUTION TYPES AND APPROACHES]
- Industry trend queries: [QUESTIONS ABOUT INDUSTRY TRENDS AND FUTURE]

# BUSINESS CONTEXT
- Company: [YOUR COMPANY NAME]
- Industry: [YOUR INDUSTRY AND EXPERTISE AREAS]
- Competitive landscape: [KEY COMPETITORS]

Please provide:
1. AI Search Optimization Strategy Overview
2. Content Authority Building Strategy
3. Query-Specific Content Recommendations
4. Citation Enhancement Tactics
5. Implementation Roadmap (30/60/90 days)
6. Success Measurement Framework

title: Account-Based Personalization
description: Create highly customized marketing approaches for strategic target accounts
prompt:
You are an account-based marketing strategist and personalization expert who specializes in creating highly customized marketing approaches for strategic target accounts.

# CONTEXT
I need to develop sophisticated account-based personalization strategies that treat high-value accounts as markets of one, with customized messaging, content, and engagement approaches.

# TARGET ACCOUNT INFORMATION
**Account Tier Structure:**
- Tier 1 accounts: [TOP 10-25 HIGHEST VALUE TARGET ACCOUNTS]
- Tier 2 accounts: [NEXT 25-50 HIGH VALUE TARGET ACCOUNTS]
- Tier 3 accounts: [BROADER SET OF 100-200 TARGET ACCOUNTS]

**Account Selection Criteria:**
- Revenue potential: [EXPECTED REVENUE FROM TARGET ACCOUNTS]
- Strategic importance: [WHY THESE ACCOUNTS ARE STRATEGICALLY IMPORTANT]
- Fit assessment: [HOW WELL THESE ACCOUNTS FIT YOUR IDEAL CUSTOMER PROFILE]

# BUSINESS CONTEXT
- Company: [YOUR COMPANY NAME]
- ABM experience level: [YOUR CURRENT ACCOUNT-BASED MARKETING MATURITY]
- Sales process: [YOUR SALES PROCESS FOR STRATEGIC ACCOUNTS]
- Technology stack: [ABM TECHNOLOGY AND TOOLS AVAILABLE]

Please provide:
1. Account Intelligence and Research Framework
2. Stakeholder Mapping and Personalization Strategy
3. Account-Specific Messaging Framework
4. Custom Content Development Plan
5. Multi-Channel Engagement Strategy
6. Success Measurement and KPIs

title: Automated Personalization Sequences
description: Design automated email sequences that deliver personalized experiences at scale
prompt:
You are a marketing automation strategist and personalization expert who specializes in creating automated email sequences that deliver highly personalized experiences at scale.

# CONTEXT
I need to design automated marketing sequences that use customer data and behavioral triggers to deliver personalized experiences that feel individually crafted.

# CUSTOMER DATA FOR AUTOMATION
**Customer Profile Data:**
- Demographics/firmographics: [CUSTOMER CHARACTERISTICS AVAILABLE]
- Behavioral data: [WEBSITE BEHAVIOR, EMAIL ENGAGEMENT, CONTENT CONSUMPTION]
- Purchase history: [PAST PURCHASES, ORDER VALUES, TIMING PATTERNS]
- Preference data: [COMMUNICATION PREFERENCES, CONTENT PREFERENCES]

**Trigger Event Data:**
- Website behaviors: [SPECIFIC WEBSITE ACTIONS THAT TRIGGER SEQUENCES]
- Email interactions: [EMAIL BEHAVIORS THAT TRIGGER FOLLOW-UP]
- Purchase behaviors: [PURCHASE ACTIONS THAT TRIGGER SEQUENCES]
- Lifecycle transitions: [CUSTOMER LIFECYCLE CHANGES THAT TRIGGER COMMUNICATION]

# BUSINESS CONTEXT
- Company: [YOUR COMPANY NAME]
- Products/services: [WHAT YOU OFFER]
- Customer journey stages: [YOUR CUSTOMER JOURNEY FRAMEWORK]
- Technology stack: [YOUR MARKETING AUTOMATION PLATFORM]

Please provide:
1. Welcome and Onboarding Sequence Design
2. Behavioral Trigger Sequence Framework
3. Re-engagement Sequence Strategy
4. Dynamic Content Personalization Rules
5. Sequence Orchestration Plan
6. Performance Measurement Framework

title: Behavioral Segmentation Builder
description: Create actionable customer segments based on observed behaviors rather than demographics
prompt:
You are a behavioral analytics expert and customer segmentation strategist who specializes in creating actionable customer segments based on observed behaviors.

# CONTEXT
I need to create behavioral customer segments that reflect how customers actually interact with our business, enabling more effective personalization and marketing strategies.

# CUSTOMER BEHAVIORAL DATA
**Website Behavior Data:**
- Page visit patterns: [CUSTOMER NAVIGATION AND PAGE CONSUMPTION PATTERNS]
- Session characteristics: [SESSION LENGTH, FREQUENCY, DEPTH]
- Content engagement: [WHICH CONTENT TYPES CUSTOMERS ENGAGE WITH MOST]
- Conversion paths: [TYPICAL CUSTOMER JOURNEY PATHS TO CONVERSION]

**Purchase Behavior Data:**
- Buying frequency: [HOW OFTEN DIFFERENT CUSTOMERS PURCHASE]
- Purchase timing: [SEASONAL OR CYCLICAL PURCHASE PATTERNS]
- Order characteristics: [TYPICAL ORDER SIZE, PRODUCT MIX]

**Communication Engagement Data:**
- Email behavior: [OPEN RATES, CLICK PATTERNS, RESPONSE TIMING]
- Social media engagement: [HOW CUSTOMERS INTERACT ON SOCIAL PLATFORMS]

# BUSINESS CONTEXT
- Company: [YOUR COMPANY NAME]
- Industry: [YOUR INDUSTRY AND BUSINESS MODEL]
- Customer base size: [APPROXIMATE NUMBER OF CUSTOMERS TO SEGMENT]
- Business objectives: [WHAT YOU WANT TO ACHIEVE WITH SEGMENTATION]

Please provide:
1. Behavioral Pattern Analysis
2. 4-6 Distinct Behavioral Segments with Profiles
3. Segment-Specific Marketing Strategies
4. Personalization Implementation Guide
5. Segment Performance Metrics
6. Continuous Optimization Framework

title: Brand Activation Planner
description: Plan successful introduction of new or refreshed brand identities to market
prompt:
You are a brand activation strategist and launch expert who specializes in successfully introducing new or refreshed brand identities to the market.

# CONTEXT
I need to create a comprehensive brand activation plan that introduces our new or refined brand identity in a way that feels authentic and drives business results.

# BRAND ACTIVATION CONTEXT
**Type of Brand Activation:**
- Activation type: [NEW BRAND LAUNCH / BRAND REFRESH / REBRAND / REPOSITIONING]
- Scope of change: [COMPLETE OVERHAUL / EVOLUTION / MESSAGING UPDATE / VISUAL REFRESH]
- Reason for change: [WHY YOU'RE ACTIVATING NEW BRAND]

**Current Brand State:**
- Existing brand recognition: [CURRENT LEVEL OF BRAND AWARENESS]
- Customer brand perception: [HOW CUSTOMERS CURRENTLY VIEW YOUR BRAND]
- Market position: [CURRENT COMPETITIVE POSITION]

**New Brand Identity:**
- New brand positioning: [YOUR NEW BRAND POSITIONING]
- New brand personality: [NEW BRAND PERSONALITY CHARACTERISTICS]
- New visual identity: [CHANGES TO LOGO, COLORS, DESIGN]
- New messaging: [NEW KEY MESSAGES]

# BUSINESS CONTEXT
- Company: [YOUR COMPANY NAME]
- Industry: [YOUR INDUSTRY AND MARKET]
- Timeline requirements: [ANY DEADLINE OR TIMING CONSTRAINTS]
- Budget parameters: [BUDGET RANGE FOR BRAND ACTIVATION]

Please provide:
1. Internal Alignment Strategy
2. Pre-Launch Foundation Plan
3. Launch Sequence and Timeline
4. Customer Communication Strategy
5. Channel and Platform Rollout Plan
6. Risk Management and Contingency Plans
7. Success Measurement Framework

title: Brand Archetype Identifier
description: Identify and implement brand archetypes for emotional connection and consistent expression
prompt:
You are a brand psychology expert and archetypal brand strategist who helps companies identify and implement brand archetypes that create emotional connection.

# CONTEXT
I need to identify our brand archetype based on customer perceptions, brand aspirations, and business characteristics to create more consistent and emotionally resonant brand communication.

# BRAND ASSESSMENT DATA
**Current Brand Expression:**
- Current brand messaging: [YOUR CURRENT BRAND MESSAGES AND COPY]
- Visual brand style: [DESCRIBE YOUR CURRENT VISUAL BRAND]
- Communication tone: [HOW YOU CURRENTLY COMMUNICATE]
- Customer interactions: [HOW YOU TYPICALLY INTERACT WITH CUSTOMERS]

**Customer Perceptions:**
- Customer feedback about brand: [WHAT CUSTOMERS SAY ABOUT YOUR BRAND PERSONALITY]
- Brand associations: [WHAT CUSTOMERS ASSOCIATE WITH YOUR BRAND]
- Emotional responses: [HOW CUSTOMERS SAY YOUR BRAND MAKES THEM FEEL]

**Brand Aspirations:**
- Desired brand perception: [HOW YOU WANT TO BE PERCEIVED]
- Brand values: [YOUR CORE BRAND VALUES]
- Mission and purpose: [YOUR BRAND'S DEEPER PURPOSE]

# BUSINESS CONTEXT
- Company: [YOUR COMPANY NAME]
- Industry: [YOUR INDUSTRY AND MARKET POSITION]
- Target audience: [YOUR IDEAL CUSTOMERS]
- Competitive landscape: [KEY COMPETITORS AND THEIR BRAND PERSONALITIES]

Please analyze against the 12 Brand Archetypes (Innocent, Sage, Explorer, Outlaw, Magician, Hero, Lover, Jester, Everyman, Caregiver, Ruler, Creator) and provide:
1. Current Brand Archetype Assessment
2. Primary Archetype Recommendation with Rationale
3. Secondary Archetype Influence
4. Brand Personality Expression Guidelines
5. Visual and Communication Style Guide
6. Cross-Functional Implementation Strategy

title: Brand Differentiation Analyzer
description: Analyze competitive landscape and identify unique brand positioning opportunities
prompt:
You are a brand strategist and competitive analyst who specializes in identifying unique positioning opportunities that differentiate brands in crowded markets.

# CONTEXT
I need to analyze our competitive landscape and identify meaningful differentiation opportunities that will set our brand apart and resonate with our target audience.

# COMPETITIVE LANDSCAPE
**Your Brand:**
- Company: [YOUR COMPANY NAME]
- Current positioning: [HOW YOU CURRENTLY POSITION YOUR BRAND]
- Key messages: [YOUR MAIN BRAND MESSAGES]
- Value proposition: [YOUR CURRENT VALUE PROPOSITION]
- Target audience: [WHO YOU'RE TRYING TO REACH]

**Competitor Analysis:**
- Competitor 1: [NAME, POSITIONING, KEY MESSAGES, STRENGTHS]
- Competitor 2: [NAME, POSITIONING, KEY MESSAGES, STRENGTHS]
- Competitor 3: [NAME, POSITIONING, KEY MESSAGES, STRENGTHS]
- Competitor 4: [NAME, POSITIONING, KEY MESSAGES, STRENGTHS]

**Market Context:**
- Industry trends: [CURRENT TRENDS IN YOUR INDUSTRY]
- Customer expectations: [WHAT CUSTOMERS EXPECT FROM BRANDS IN YOUR SPACE]
- Unmet needs: [GAPS IN THE MARKET YOU'VE IDENTIFIED]

# BUSINESS CONTEXT
- Industry: [YOUR INDUSTRY]
- Business model: [HOW YOU OPERATE AND MAKE MONEY]
- Unique capabilities: [WHAT YOU DO BETTER THAN ANYONE ELSE]
- Growth objectives: [YOUR GROWTH GOALS]

Please provide:
1. Competitive Positioning Map
2. Differentiation Gap Analysis
3. Unique Value Proposition Recommendations
4. Messaging Differentiation Strategy
5. Proof Point Development
6. Implementation Roadmap

title: Brand Evolution Roadmap
description: Create a strategic plan for evolving your brand over time while maintaining consistency
prompt:
You are a brand evolution strategist who helps companies plan and execute long-term brand development while maintaining consistency and customer trust.

# CONTEXT
I need to create a strategic roadmap for evolving our brand over the next 12-24 months in response to market changes, business growth, and evolving customer expectations.

# CURRENT BRAND STATE
**Brand Foundation:**
- Brand positioning: [YOUR CURRENT BRAND POSITIONING]
- Brand values: [YOUR CORE BRAND VALUES]
- Brand personality: [YOUR BRAND'S PERSONALITY TRAITS]
- Visual identity: [CURRENT VISUAL BRAND ELEMENTS]
- Brand voice: [HOW YOUR BRAND COMMUNICATES]

**Brand Performance:**
- Brand awareness: [CURRENT AWARENESS LEVELS]
- Brand perception: [HOW CUSTOMERS PERCEIVE YOUR BRAND]
- Brand equity: [VALUE OF YOUR BRAND]
- Customer loyalty: [LOYALTY AND RETENTION METRICS]

# EVOLUTION DRIVERS
**Market Changes:**
- Industry trends: [TRENDS AFFECTING YOUR INDUSTRY]
- Competitive shifts: [HOW COMPETITION IS EVOLVING]
- Customer evolution: [HOW YOUR CUSTOMERS ARE CHANGING]
- Technology impact: [HOW TECHNOLOGY IS AFFECTING YOUR MARKET]

**Business Growth:**
- Growth objectives: [YOUR BUSINESS GROWTH PLANS]
- New markets: [NEW MARKETS YOU'RE ENTERING]
- New products/services: [NEW OFFERINGS PLANNED]
- Organizational changes: [COMPANY CHANGES AFFECTING BRAND]

# BUSINESS CONTEXT
- Company: [YOUR COMPANY NAME]
- Industry: [YOUR INDUSTRY]
- Company stage: [STARTUP, GROWTH, ESTABLISHED, ETC.]
- Resources: [RESOURCES AVAILABLE FOR BRAND EVOLUTION]

Please provide:
1. Brand Evolution Assessment
2. Evolution Opportunity Analysis
3. Phased Evolution Roadmap (12-24 months)
4. Consistency Maintenance Guidelines
5. Stakeholder Communication Plan
6. Success Metrics and Milestones

title: Brand Personality Profiler
description: Create detailed brand personality profiles that guide consistent communication across all touchpoints
prompt:
You are a brand strategist and personality psychology expert who creates detailed brand personality profiles that guide consistent communication across all touchpoints.

# CONTEXT
I need to define our brand personality as if our brand were a person - with distinct characteristics, communication style, values, and behaviors that create consistent and engaging customer experiences.

# BRAND COMMUNICATION EXAMPLES
Please analyze:
- Current marketing copy: [PASTE WEBSITE COPY, EMAIL EXAMPLES, ADS]
- Customer service interactions: [PASTE EXAMPLES OF SUPPORT CONVERSATIONS]
- Social media posts: [PASTE RECENT SOCIAL MEDIA CONTENT]
- Sales conversations: [PASTE EXAMPLES OF SALES MESSAGING]

# COMPANY CONTEXT
- Company: [YOUR COMPANY NAME]
- Industry: [YOUR INDUSTRY AND BUSINESS MODEL]
- Target audience: [DETAILED CUSTOMER DESCRIPTION]
- Company culture: [DESCRIBE YOUR TEAM/CULTURE CHARACTERISTICS]
- Brand aspirations: [HOW YOU WANT TO BE PERCEIVED]

Please provide:
1. Current Personality Indicators Analysis
2. Core Personality Traits (5-7 key characteristics)
3. Communication Style Preferences
4. Values and Beliefs Expression
5. Relationship Style Guidelines
6. Situational Behavior Guidelines (excitement, frustration, new ideas, competition)

title: Brand Story Architect
description: Create compelling brand stories that connect emotionally while driving business results
prompt:
You are a brand storytelling expert and narrative strategist who creates compelling brand stories that connect emotionally with audiences while driving business results.

# CONTEXT
I need to develop our complete brand story that explains not just what we do, but why we exist, how we're different, and how customers become part of our ongoing story.

# BRAND STORY FOUNDATION
**Company Background:**
- Company name: [YOUR COMPANY NAME]
- Founding story: [HOW/WHY THE COMPANY WAS FOUNDED]
- Key founding moments: [PIVOTAL EARLY DECISIONS/EVENTS]
- Original problem focus: [WHAT PROBLEM WERE YOU TRYING TO SOLVE]

**Business Evolution:**
- Major milestones: [KEY ACHIEVEMENTS/TURNING POINTS]
- Customer impact stories: [EXAMPLES OF HOW YOU'VE TRANSFORMED CUSTOMERS]

**Current State:**
- Products/services: [WHAT YOU OFFER TODAY]
- Target customers: [WHO YOU SERVE NOW]
- Unique value: [WHAT MAKES YOU DIFFERENT]
- Future vision: [WHERE YOU'RE HEADED]

Please provide:
1. Core Narrative Elements (Challenge, Journey, Transformation, Vision)
2. Full Brand Story (300-500 words)
3. Elevator Pitch Version (30 seconds)
4. Social Media Bio Version
5. Customer-Centric Story Version
6. Story Application Guidelines by Channel

title: Buyer Persona Validator
description: Validate existing buyer personas against real customer data to identify gaps and updates
prompt:
You are a customer research analyst specializing in persona validation, with expertise in comparing assumed buyer characteristics against actual customer data.

# CONTEXT
I have existing buyer personas that may be outdated or inaccurate. I need to validate these against real customer data and update them to reflect current reality.

# CURRENT PERSONAS TO VALIDATE
[PASTE YOUR CURRENT BUYER PERSONA DESCRIPTIONS - INCLUDE DEMOGRAPHICS, GOALS, CHALLENGES, BEHAVIORS]

# ACTUAL CUSTOMER DATA FOR COMPARISON
- CRM customer records: [PASTE ACTUAL CUSTOMER DEMOGRAPHIC/FIRMOGRAPHIC DATA]
- Customer survey results: [PASTE SURVEY RESPONSES ABOUT GOALS, CHALLENGES]
- Sales conversation insights: [PASTE THEMES FROM ACTUAL SALES CALLS]
- Customer behavior data: [PASTE WEBSITE BEHAVIOR, EMAIL ENGAGEMENT]
- Support interaction patterns: [PASTE CUSTOMER SUPPORT THEMES]

# BUSINESS CONTEXT
- Company: [YOUR COMPANY NAME]
- Time since personas were created: [HOW OLD ARE CURRENT PERSONAS]
- Market changes: [ANY MAJOR INDUSTRY OR MARKET SHIFTS]
- Product evolution: [HOW YOUR OFFERING HAS CHANGED]

Please provide:
1. Overall Persona Accuracy Assessment (% scores)
2. Demographics/Firmographics Validation
3. Goals and Objectives Validation
4. Challenges and Pain Points Validation
5. Behavior Patterns Validation
6. Updated Persona Recommendations

title: Campaign Concept Generator
description: Generate creative campaign concepts that align with brand identity and drive business results
prompt:
You are a creative campaign strategist who creates innovative marketing campaigns that authentically express brand identity while delivering measurable business results.

# CONTEXT
I need to generate several creative campaign concepts that align with our brand identity, address customer needs, and support our business goals while standing out from competitors.

# BRAND AND BUSINESS FOUNDATION
**Brand Identity:**
- Company: [YOUR COMPANY NAME]
- Brand positioning: [YOUR BRAND POSITIONING STATEMENT]
- Brand personality: [YOUR BRAND PERSONALITY CHARACTERISTICS]
- Brand voice: [YOUR BRAND VOICE AND TONE]

**Target Audience:**
- Primary customer segments: [YOUR IDEAL CUSTOMER PROFILES]
- Customer challenges: [MAIN PROBLEMS YOUR CUSTOMERS FACE]
- Customer goals: [WHAT YOUR CUSTOMERS WANT TO ACHIEVE]

**Business Context:**
- Products/services: [WHAT YOU OFFER]
- Business goals: [CURRENT MARKETING/BUSINESS OBJECTIVES]
- Competitive landscape: [KEY COMPETITORS AND THEIR RECENT CAMPAIGNS]
- Budget considerations: [CAMPAIGN BUDGET RANGE]

Please provide:
1. Campaign Strategy Overview
2. 5-7 Campaign Concepts with:
   - Campaign theme and core message
   - Brand connection
   - Target audience and customer need addressed
   - Creative execution approach
   - Channel recommendations
   - Success metrics
3. Implementation Timeline Recommendations

title: Competitive Voice Analysis
description: Analyze competitor communication patterns to identify differentiation opportunities
prompt:
You are a competitive brand analyst and voice strategist who analyzes competitor communication patterns to identify differentiation opportunities.

# CONTEXT
I need to understand how our competitors communicate so I can identify opportunities to differentiate our brand voice and messaging approach.

# COMPETITOR INFORMATION TO ANALYZE
- Competitor 1: [NAME] - [PASTE THEIR WEBSITE COPY, MARKETING MESSAGES, SOCIAL CONTENT]
- Competitor 2: [NAME] - [PASTE THEIR WEBSITE COPY, MARKETING MESSAGES, SOCIAL CONTENT]
- Competitor 3: [NAME] - [PASTE THEIR WEBSITE COPY, MARKETING MESSAGES, SOCIAL CONTENT]
- Competitor 4: [NAME] - [PASTE THEIR WEBSITE COPY, MARKETING MESSAGES, SOCIAL CONTENT]

# YOUR BRAND CONTEXT
- Company: [YOUR COMPANY NAME]
- Current brand voice: [YOUR CURRENT VOICE CHARACTERISTICS]
- Brand values: [YOUR CORE BRAND VALUES]
- Target audience: [YOUR IDEAL CUSTOMERS]
- Unique positioning: [WHAT MAKES YOU DIFFERENT]

Please provide:
1. Overall Industry Communication Patterns
2. Individual Competitor Voice Profiles:
   - Voice personality characteristics
   - Tone and language analysis
   - Message and content patterns
   - Strengths and weaknesses
3. Voice Differentiation Opportunities
4. Recommended Unique Voice Strategy
5. Implementation Guidelines

title: Competitor Gap Finder
description: Identify positioning gaps in competitor messaging to find ownable market opportunities
prompt:
You are a competitive intelligence specialist with expertise in identifying positioning gaps and market opportunities.

# CONTEXT
I want to identify gaps in our competitors' messaging and positioning to find opportunities we can own in the market.

# COMPETITOR INFORMATION
- Primary competitors: [LIST 5-7 MAIN COMPETITORS]
- Competitor websites/messaging: [PASTE COMPETITOR WEBSITE COPY, TAGLINES, VALUE PROPS]
- Industry landscape: [DESCRIBE YOUR INDUSTRY - B2B/B2C, MARKET SIZE, TRENDS]

# YOUR COMPANY CONTEXT
- Company: [YOUR COMPANY NAME]
- Target customers: [YOUR IDEAL CUSTOMER PROFILE]
- Core capabilities: [YOUR KEY STRENGTHS/CAPABILITIES]
- Current positioning: [YOUR CURRENT BRAND POSITIONING]

Please provide:
1. Competitor Messaging Analysis:
   - Common themes all competitors address
   - Messaging patterns (tone, style, proof points)
2. Gap Opportunities:
   - Unaddressed problems (3-5)
   - Underserved segments (2-3)
   - Positioning opportunities (3-5)
3. Strategic Recommendations:
   - Priority gap to own
   - Quick wins
   - Long-term strategy
   - Risks to monitor

title: Content Amplification Engine
description: Maximize content reach through strategic repurposing and cross-platform distribution
prompt:
You are a content amplification strategist who specializes in extending the reach and impact of existing content through strategic repurposing and cross-platform distribution.

# CONTEXT
I need to maximize the value and reach of our existing content by creating systematic amplification strategies across multiple channels and formats.

# EXISTING CONTENT ASSESSMENT
**Content Inventory:**
- High-performing content: [CONTENT WITH HIGHEST ENGAGEMENT/CONVERSION]
- Evergreen content: [CONTENT WITH LASTING VALUE]
- Video content: [EXISTING VIDEO CONTENT AND CLIPS]
- Written content: [BLOG POSTS, GUIDES, WHITEPAPERS, CASE STUDIES]
- Visual content: [INFOGRAPHICS, SLIDE DECKS, CHARTS]

**Content Performance Data:**
- Traffic and engagement: [CURRENT CONTENT METRICS]
- Conversion performance: [WHICH CONTENT DRIVES BEST CONVERSIONS]
- Social media performance: [HOW CONTENT PERFORMS ON SOCIAL]

# AUDIENCE AND PLATFORM ANALYSIS
- Platform usage patterns: [WHERE YOUR AUDIENCE SPENDS TIME ONLINE]
- Content consumption preferences: [HOW AUDIENCE PREFERS TO CONSUME CONTENT]
- Underutilized platforms: [PLATFORMS WHERE YOU COULD AMPLIFY MORE]

Please provide:
1. Content Audit and Prioritization
2. Multi-Format Repurposing Framework
3. Platform-Specific Distribution Strategies
4. Content Atomization Plan (breaking content into smaller pieces)
5. Amplification Calendar Template
6. Performance Measurement Framework

title: Content Theme Generator
description: Develop cohesive content themes that align brand identity with audience needs
prompt:
You are a content strategist and editorial director with expertise in developing cohesive content themes that align brand identity with audience needs.

# CONTEXT
I need to develop 5-7 core content themes that will guide all our content creation, ensuring consistency with our brand while addressing our audience's most important needs.

# BRAND AND AUDIENCE CONTEXT
**Brand Identity:**
- Brand positioning: [YOUR BRAND POSITIONING STATEMENT]
- Brand voice/personality: [YOUR BRAND VOICE CHARACTERISTICS]
- Unique value proposition: [WHAT MAKES YOU DIFFERENT]
- Brand mission/purpose: [YOUR DEEPER PURPOSE]

**Target Audience:**
- Primary customer segments: [YOUR IDEAL CUSTOMER PROFILES]
- Customer goals and challenges: [MAIN THINGS YOUR CUSTOMERS CARE ABOUT]
- Content consumption preferences: [HOW YOUR AUDIENCE CONSUMES CONTENT]
- Customer journey stages: [AWARENESS/CONSIDERATION/DECISION/SUCCESS]

**Business Context:**
- Company: [YOUR COMPANY NAME]
- Industry: [YOUR INDUSTRY AND MARKET]
- Products/services: [WHAT YOU OFFER]
- Business goals: [MARKETING/BUSINESS OBJECTIVES]

Please provide for each of 5-7 themes:
1. Theme Description and Core Message
2. Brand Connection
3. Customer Journey Alignment
4. Unique Angle/Perspective
5. Content Execution Guidelines
6. Format Recommendations
7. 5 Starter Content Ideas

title: Contextual Messaging Framework
description: Create messaging that adapts intelligently to different customer contexts and situations
prompt:
You are a contextual messaging strategist who creates messaging frameworks that automatically adapt to customer context, situation, and circumstances.

# CONTEXT
I need to develop messaging that adapts intelligently to different customer contexts, ensuring every communication feels relevant regardless of when or how customers encounter our brand.

# CORE MESSAGING FOUNDATION
- Primary brand message: [YOUR CORE BRAND MESSAGE/VALUE PROPOSITION]
- Supporting messages: [YOUR KEY SUPPORTING BRAND MESSAGES]
- Proof points: [YOUR PRIMARY EVIDENCE AND CREDIBILITY BUILDERS]
- Call-to-action hierarchy: [YOUR PRIMARY AND SECONDARY CTAs]

# CONTEXTUAL VARIABLES TO CONSIDER
**Situational Context:**
- Industry context: [INDUSTRY-SPECIFIC FACTORS]
- Company context: [COMPANY SIZE, STAGE FACTORS]
- Seasonal context: [SEASONAL FACTORS]
- Economic context: [ECONOMIC CONDITIONS]

**Customer State Context:**
- Journey stage: [AWARENESS/CONSIDERATION/DECISION]
- Engagement level: [NEW/ENGAGED/LOYAL]
- Purchase readiness: [BROWSING/EVALUATING/READY]
- Problem urgency: [LOW/MEDIUM/HIGH]

**Communication Context:**
- Channel: [EMAIL/SOCIAL/WEB/ADS]
- Timing: [MORNING/AFTERNOON/EVENING]
- Device: [MOBILE/DESKTOP]

Please provide:
1. Context Recognition Framework
2. Message Adaptation Rules by Context
3. Channel-Specific Messaging Variations
4. Journey Stage Adaptations
5. Industry/Segment Customizations
6. Brand Consistency Guidelines

title: Conversion Path Optimizer
description: Design personalized conversion paths for different customer types and decision-making styles
prompt:
You are a conversion optimization strategist who creates customized conversion paths that adapt to different customer characteristics and decision-making processes.

# CONTEXT
I need to optimize our conversion funnels by creating multiple paths that accommodate different customer types, decision-making styles, and contextual factors.

# CURRENT CONVERSION FUNNEL ANALYSIS
- Primary conversion funnel: [YOUR CURRENT MAIN CONVERSION PROCESS]
- Conversion steps: [SPECIFIC STEPS IN CURRENT PROCESS]
- Drop-off points: [WHERE CUSTOMERS TYPICALLY ABANDON]
- Current conversion rates: [CONVERSION RATES AT EACH STEP]

# CUSTOMER DECISION-MAKING STYLES
- Quick decision makers: [CUSTOMERS WHO DECIDE QUICKLY]
- Deliberate evaluators: [CUSTOMERS WHO NEED TIME AND INFORMATION]
- Consensus builders: [CUSTOMERS WHO NEED TO INVOLVE OTHERS]
- Risk-averse customers: [CUSTOMERS WHO NEED RISK MITIGATION]
- Value-focused customers: [CUSTOMERS WHO PRIORITIZE VALUE]

# BUSINESS CONTEXT
- Company: [YOUR COMPANY NAME]
- Products/services: [WHAT CUSTOMERS ARE CONVERTING TO BUY/TRY]
- Sales process integration: [HOW CONVERSION INTEGRATES WITH SALES]
- Technology capabilities: [CONVERSION OPTIMIZATION TECH AVAILABLE]

Please provide:
1. Conversion Path Strategy Overview
2. Express Path (Quick Decision Makers)
3. Comprehensive Path (Deliberate Evaluators)
4. Collaborative Path (Consensus Builders)
5. Trust-Building Path (Risk-Averse)
6. Friction Reduction Recommendations
7. A/B Testing Priorities

title: Cross-Channel Message Sync
description: Create seamless personalized experiences that maintain consistency across all marketing channels
prompt:
You are a cross-channel experience strategist who specializes in creating seamless, personalized customer experiences that maintain consistency across all marketing touchpoints.

# CONTEXT
I need to ensure that personalized messaging and customer experiences remain consistent and contextually aware across all channels, so customers have a seamless experience regardless of how they interact with our brand.

# CURRENT CHANNEL INVENTORY
**Digital Channels:**
- Website and landing pages: [WEBSITE PERSONALIZATION CAPABILITIES]
- Email marketing: [EMAIL PERSONALIZATION CURRENT STATE]
- Social media platforms: [SOCIAL MEDIA PRESENCE AND PERSONALIZATION]
- Paid advertising: [PAID ADVERTISING CHANNELS AND TARGETING]
- Mobile app: [MOBILE APP PERSONALIZATION IF APPLICABLE]

**Sales and Service Channels:**
- Sales team interactions: [SALES PROCESS AND CUSTOMER INTERACTION]
- Customer support: [SUPPORT CHANNELS AND PERSONALIZATION]
- Live chat and chatbots: [CHAT PERSONALIZATION AND CONTEXT AWARENESS]

# CUSTOMER DATA SOURCES
- CRM data: [CUSTOMER RELATIONSHIP DATA AVAILABLE]
- Website analytics: [BEHAVIORAL DATA FROM WEBSITE]
- Email engagement data: [EMAIL INTERACTION HISTORY]
- Cross-channel behavior: [HOW CUSTOMERS USE DIFFERENT CHANNELS]

# BUSINESS CONTEXT
- Company: [YOUR COMPANY NAME]
- Technology integration level: [HOW WELL YOUR SYSTEMS INTEGRATE]
- Personalization maturity: [YOUR CURRENT PERSONALIZATION SOPHISTICATION]

Please provide:
1. Cross-Channel Message Architecture
2. Channel-Specific Adaptation Guidelines
3. Context Handoff Protocols (channel to channel)
4. Real-Time Synchronization Strategy
5. Brand Consistency Framework
6. Technology Integration Requirements
7. Performance Measurement Framework

title: Cross-Platform Content Strategy
description: Adapt content for optimal performance across different platforms while maintaining brand consistency
prompt:
You are a cross-platform content strategist who specializes in adapting content for optimal performance across different platforms while maintaining brand consistency.

# CONTEXT
I need to create systematic approaches for adapting our core content to perform optimally on different platforms, recognizing that each has unique audience expectations and engagement patterns.

# CORE CONTENT ASSETS
- Primary content themes: [YOUR MAIN CONTENT THEMES AND TOPICS]
- Key messages: [YOUR CORE BRAND MESSAGES AND VALUE PROPOSITIONS]
- Thought leadership content: [YOUR THOUGHT LEADERSHIP CONTENT]
- Educational content: [YOUR EDUCATIONAL AND HOW-TO CONTENT]
- Customer story content: [YOUR CUSTOMER SUCCESS STORIES]

# BRAND CONSISTENCY REQUIREMENTS
- Brand voice and tone: [YOUR BRAND VOICE CHARACTERISTICS]
- Visual brand elements: [YOUR VISUAL BRAND STANDARDS]
- Message hierarchy: [YOUR MESSAGE PRIORITY AND HIERARCHY]

# TARGET PLATFORMS
- Professional platforms: [LINKEDIN AND INDUSTRY-SPECIFIC PLATFORMS]
- Social media platforms: [FACEBOOK, TWITTER, INSTAGRAM, TIKTOK]
- Video platforms: [YOUTUBE, VIMEO]
- Content platforms: [MEDIUM, SUBSTACK, INDUSTRY PUBLICATIONS]
- Community platforms: [REDDIT, DISCORD, INDUSTRY FORUMS]

# BUSINESS CONTEXT
- Company: [YOUR COMPANY NAME]
- Content creation resources: [TEAM AND TOOLS AVAILABLE]
- Platform management capacity: [CAPACITY FOR MANAGING MULTIPLE PLATFORMS]

Please provide:
1. Platform Culture and Format Analysis
2. Content Adaptation Framework by Platform
3. Cross-Platform Content Calendar Template
4. Repurposing Workflow (one piece → many platforms)
5. Brand Consistency Checkpoints
6. Performance Metrics by Platform

title: Customer Advocacy Amplifier
description: Turn satisfied customers into active brand promoters through systematic advocacy programs
prompt:
You are a customer advocacy strategist who specializes in creating programs that turn satisfied customers into active brand promoters, referral sources, and marketing amplifiers.

# CONTEXT
I need to develop comprehensive customer advocacy programs that systematically identify, engage, and support satisfied customers in becoming active promoters through referrals, testimonials, and peer influence.

# CURRENT ADVOCACY STATE
- Existing customer advocates: [CUSTOMERS WHO CURRENTLY ADVOCATE FOR YOUR BRAND]
- Referral patterns: [CURRENT CUSTOMER REFERRAL PATTERNS]
- Testimonial generation: [CURRENT RATE OF TESTIMONIALS AND REVIEWS]
- Social media advocacy: [CUSTOMERS WHO PROMOTE ON SOCIAL]
- Word-of-mouth influence: [CURRENT WOM MARKETING INFLUENCE]

# ADVOCATE POTENTIAL INDICATORS
- High-satisfaction customers: [CUSTOMERS WITH HIGHEST SATISFACTION SCORES]
- Successful implementations: [CUSTOMERS WHO ACHIEVED NOTABLE SUCCESS]
- Long-term customers: [CUSTOMERS WITH LONGEST RELATIONSHIPS]
- Industry influencers: [CUSTOMERS WITH INDUSTRY INFLUENCE]
- Social media active: [CUSTOMERS ACTIVE ON SOCIAL MEDIA]

# BUSINESS CONTEXT
- Company: [YOUR COMPANY NAME]
- Customer relationship depth: [DEPTH OF RELATIONSHIPS WITH CUSTOMERS]
- Success story inventory: [CURRENT INVENTORY OF SUCCESS STORIES]
- Legal considerations: [LEGAL REQUIREMENTS FOR ADVOCACY PROGRAMS]

Please provide:
1. Advocate Identification Framework
2. Tiered Advocacy Program Design
3. Engagement and Activation Tactics
4. Referral Program Structure
5. Testimonial and Case Study Collection Process
6. Recognition and Reward System
7. Success Measurement Framework

title: Customer Data Enrichment Strategist
description: Identify high-value data enrichment opportunities to improve personalization and predict behavior
prompt:
You are a customer data strategist who specializes in identifying high-value data enrichment opportunities that improve personalization and predict customer behavior.

# CONTEXT
I need to enhance our customer database with additional data points that will enable better personalization, more accurate intent prediction, and more effective marketing automation.

# CURRENT DATA ASSESSMENT
**Existing Data Points:**
- CRM data fields: [LIST CURRENT CUSTOMER DATA FIELDS]
- Website behavioral data: [WHAT WEBSITE BEHAVIOR YOU TRACK]
- Email engagement data: [EMAIL METRICS YOU CAPTURE]
- Transaction history: [PURCHASE/TRANSACTION DATA AVAILABLE]
- Support interaction data: [CUSTOMER SERVICE DATA]
- Product usage data: [HOW CUSTOMERS USE YOUR PRODUCT]

**Data Collection Methods:**
- Form submissions: [WHAT FORMS COLLECT DATA]
- Progressive profiling: [HOW YOU BUILD PROFILES OVER TIME]
- Third-party integrations: [EXTERNAL DATA SOURCES]

# BUSINESS CONTEXT
- Company: [YOUR COMPANY NAME]
- Industry: [YOUR INDUSTRY AND BUSINESS MODEL]
- Target customers: [YOUR IDEAL CUSTOMER PROFILES]
- Sales cycle: [LENGTH AND COMPLEXITY OF SALES PROCESS]
- Personalization goals: [WHAT YOU WANT TO ACHIEVE]
- Technology stack: [YOUR CURRENT MARKETING/CRM TECHNOLOGY]

Please provide:
1. Current Data State Analysis
2. High-Impact Data Enrichment Opportunities (prioritized)
3. Intent Signal Identification Framework
4. Data Collection Strategy (ethical, non-intrusive)
5. Progressive Profiling Plan
6. Privacy Compliance Considerations
7. Implementation Roadmap

title: Customer Journey Drop-Off Diagnosis
description: Identify where users abandon the funnel and get tactical recommendations to reduce drop-off
prompt:
You are a customer journey analyst who examines data across funnel stages to identify drop-offs and recommend tactical solutions to reduce abandonment.

# CONTEXT
I want to understand where users are abandoning the funnel for [YOUR PRODUCT/SERVICE] targeted at [YOUR AUDIENCE/ICP]. I need you to identify the biggest drop-off point and provide tactical recommendations.

# BUSINESS CONTEXT
- Company: [YOUR COMPANY NAME]
- Product/Service: [INSERT]
- Funnel Stages: [AWARENESS, CONSIDERATION, CONVERSION, RETENTION]
- Campaign Objectives: [E.G., LEAD GEN, DEMO SIGNUPS, PURCHASES]
- Target Audience: [INSERT DESCRIPTION]
- Channels: [LIST CHANNELS DRIVING FUNNEL ENTRY]

# INPUT DATA
Provide data where available:
- CTRs by channel (Awareness)
- Engagement metrics (time on page, bounce, scroll depth)
- Conversion rates from landing pages or demo forms
- Cart/checkout abandonment rates (if ecommerce)
- Churn, renewal, or NPS metrics (Retention)
- Qualitative inputs (sales feedback, surveys, heatmaps)

Please provide:
1. Funnel Mapping with Drop-Off Percentages
2. Largest Drop-Off Point Identification
3. Root Cause Hypotheses (2+ possible causes)
4. Tactical Fixes (3+ specific recommendations)
5. Validation Methods (A/B tests to verify fixes)
6. Prioritization Matrix (Effort vs. Impact)

title: Customer Journey Mapper
description: Map the complete customer journey with insights for each stage and optimization opportunities
prompt:
You are a customer journey strategist with expertise in mapping complex B2B and B2C customer experiences and identifying optimization opportunities.

# CONTEXT
I need to map our complete customer journey to understand how customers discover, evaluate, purchase, and succeed with our solution so I can optimize each touchpoint.

# CUSTOMER RESEARCH DATA
- Customer interviews/feedback: [PASTE CUSTOMER JOURNEY FEEDBACK]
- Analytics data: [PASTE WEBSITE/APP BEHAVIOR DATA]
- Sales process insights: [PASTE SALES TEAM FEEDBACK]
- Customer support interactions: [PASTE SUPPORT CONVERSATION THEMES]
- Survey responses: [PASTE JOURNEY-RELATED SURVEY DATA]

# BUSINESS CONTEXT
- Company: [YOUR COMPANY NAME]
- Primary customer segment: [MAIN CUSTOMER TYPE TO MAP]
- Products/Services: [WHAT CUSTOMERS ARE BUYING]
- Sales process: [SALES CYCLE LENGTH AND COMPLEXITY]
- Industry context: [INDUSTRY BUYING PATTERNS]

Please provide for each journey stage (Awareness → Consideration → Decision → Onboarding → Success → Advocacy):
1. Customer Actions (what they're doing)
2. Emotions/Mindset (how they're feeling)
3. Questions/Needs (what they're trying to understand)
4. Touchpoints (where they interact with us)
5. Pain Points (where they get stuck)
6. Optimization Opportunities

title: Customer Journey Personalization
description: Design end-to-end personalized experiences that adapt based on individual customer data
prompt:
You are a customer journey strategist who specializes in creating end-to-end personalized experiences that adapt based on individual customer preferences and behaviors.

# CONTEXT
I need to design comprehensive journey personalization that adapts every touchpoint throughout the customer lifecycle based on individual customer data.

# CUSTOMER DATA AVAILABLE
**Individual Profiles:**
- Personal characteristics: [DEMOGRAPHICS, ROLE, BACKGROUND]
- Company context: [COMPANY SIZE, INDUSTRY, SITUATION]
- Behavioral patterns: [BEHAVIOR PATTERNS AND PREFERENCES]
- Communication preferences: [PREFERRED CHANNELS, TIMING, STYLE]
- Content preferences: [PREFERRED CONTENT TYPES, DEPTH, FORMAT]

**Journey Behavior Data:**
- Journey progression patterns: [HOW CUSTOMERS PROGRESS]
- Touchpoint preferences: [PREFERRED INTERACTION METHODS]
- Decision-making patterns: [HOW CUSTOMERS MAKE DECISIONS]
- Learning styles: [HOW CUSTOMERS PREFER TO LEARN]

# BUSINESS CONTEXT
- Company: [YOUR COMPANY NAME]
- Customer journey framework: [YOUR CURRENT JOURNEY STAGES]
- Personalization maturity: [YOUR CURRENT CAPABILITIES]
- Technology stack: [CUSTOMER EXPERIENCE TECHNOLOGY]
- Success metrics: [HOW YOU MEASURE JOURNEY SUCCESS]

Please provide:
1. Journey Personalization Philosophy
2. Personalization Triggers and Rules by Stage
3. Content and Message Adaptation Framework
4. Channel Preference Accommodation
5. Dynamic Journey Path Design
6. Success-Optimized Experience Guidelines
7. Technology and Data Requirements

title: Customer Language Decoder
description: Extract authentic brand voice from customer feedback to make messaging resonate naturally
prompt:
You are a brand voice strategist and linguistics expert who specializes in extracting authentic brand voice from customer feedback data.

# CONTEXT
I want to build our brand voice using the exact language our customers use to describe our value, so our messaging feels authentic and resonates naturally.

# CUSTOMER FEEDBACK DATA
Please analyze the following:
- Customer reviews: [PASTE 50-100+ CUSTOMER REVIEWS]
- Testimonials: [PASTE CUSTOMER TESTIMONIALS]
- Survey responses: [PASTE SURVEY FEEDBACK IF AVAILABLE]
- Support ticket feedback: [PASTE POSITIVE SUPPORT INTERACTIONS]
- Sales call transcripts: [PASTE CUSTOMER CONVERSATION EXCERPTS]

# COMPANY CONTEXT
- Company: [YOUR COMPANY NAME]
- Industry: [YOUR INDUSTRY]
- Target audience: [YOUR CUSTOMER DEMOGRAPHICS/PSYCHOGRAPHICS]
- Current brand voice: [DESCRIBE CURRENT VOICE IF ANY]

Please provide:
1. Most Frequent Positive Descriptors (10-15 words with frequency)
2. Emotional Language Patterns:
   - How customers FEEL about us
   - How we make them FEEL about themselves
3. Value Description Patterns:
   - Benefits customers emphasize most
   - Outcomes customers celebrate
4. Problem Language (how they describe challenges we solve)
5. Comparison Language (how they differentiate us)
6. Brand Voice Guidelines based on customer language
7. Messaging Templates using authentic customer words

title: Customer Lifecycle Mapper
description: Map customer lifecycle stages with personalized strategies for each phase of the relationship
prompt:
You are a customer lifecycle strategist and relationship optimization expert who specializes in mapping customer lifecycle stages and creating personalized strategies for each stage.

# CONTEXT
I need to map the complete customer lifecycle from initial awareness through advocacy, understanding the distinct characteristics, needs, and opportunities at each stage.

# CUSTOMER LIFECYCLE DATA TO ANALYZE
**Customer Journey Data:**
- Acquisition sources: [HOW CUSTOMERS FIRST DISCOVER AND ENGAGE WITH YOU]
- Onboarding patterns: [HOW NEW CUSTOMERS GET STARTED]
- Engagement evolution: [HOW CUSTOMER ENGAGEMENT CHANGES OVER TIME]
- Success milestones: [KEY ACHIEVEMENTS CUSTOMERS REACH]
- Retention patterns: [WHAT KEEPS CUSTOMERS LOYAL OVER TIME]

**Behavioral Transition Data:**
- Stage progression triggers: [WHAT CAUSES CUSTOMERS TO MOVE BETWEEN STAGES]
- Stagnation indicators: [SIGNS THAT CUSTOMERS ARE STUCK IN A STAGE]
- Success accelerators: [WHAT HELPS CUSTOMERS PROGRESS FASTER]

# BUSINESS CONTEXT
- Company: [YOUR COMPANY NAME]
- Business model: [SUBSCRIPTION, TRANSACTION, SERVICE, ETC.]
- Customer relationship duration: [TYPICAL LENGTH OF CUSTOMER RELATIONSHIPS]

Please provide a comprehensive lifecycle map including stage definitions, transition triggers, stage-specific needs, personalization opportunities, and success metrics for each stage from Awareness through Advocacy.

title: Customer Lifetime Value Optimizer
description: Optimize marketing investments based on accurate customer lifetime value predictions
prompt:
You are a customer lifetime value analyst who specializes in optimizing marketing investments based on accurate LTV predictions.

# CONTEXT
I need to develop LTV-based marketing optimization strategies that consider long-term customer value in all marketing decisions.

# CURRENT CUSTOMER VALUE DATA
**Customer Lifetime Value Analysis:**
- Current LTV calculation method: [HOW YOU CURRENTLY CALCULATE LTV]
- LTV by customer segment: [LTV DIFFERENCES ACROSS SEGMENTS]
- LTV by acquisition channel: [LTV BY HOW CUSTOMERS WERE ACQUIRED]

**Customer Retention and Expansion Data:**
- Customer retention rates: [RETENTION RATES BY SEGMENT, CHANNEL]
- Account expansion patterns: [HOW CUSTOMERS EXPAND VALUE OVER TIME]
- Churn patterns: [CHURN PATTERNS AND IMPACT ON LTV]

**Customer Acquisition Analysis:**
- CAC by channel: [CAC BY MARKETING CHANNEL]
- LTV to CAC ratios: [LTV:CAC RATIOS BY SEGMENT AND CHANNEL]

# BUSINESS CONTEXT
- Company: [YOUR COMPANY NAME]
- Business model: [SUBSCRIPTION, TRANSACTION, SERVICE-BASED, ETC.]
- Growth objectives: [BUSINESS GROWTH OBJECTIVES]

Please provide LTV prediction models, acquisition investment optimization, retention/expansion tactics, and segment prioritization frameworks.

title: Customer Referral Engine
description: Create systematic referral programs that turn satisfied customers into active advocates
prompt:
You are a referral marketing strategist who specializes in creating systematic referral programs that turn satisfied customers into active referral sources.

# CONTEXT
I need to develop systematic customer referral strategies that motivate satisfied customers to actively refer prospects and advocate for our brand.

# CURRENT REFERRAL STATE
**Existing Referral Activity:**
- Current referral patterns: [CURRENT CUSTOMER REFERRAL PATTERNS AND VOLUME]
- Referral sources: [CUSTOMERS WHO CURRENTLY PROVIDE REFERRALS]
- Referral conversion rates: [CONVERSION RATES OF CURRENT REFERRALS]
- Referral program existence: [ANY EXISTING REFERRAL PROGRAMS]

# BUSINESS CONTEXT
- Company: [YOUR COMPANY NAME]
- Customer satisfaction levels: [CURRENT CUSTOMER SATISFACTION SCORES]
- Customer success patterns: [CUSTOMERS WHO ACHIEVE NOTABLE SUCCESS]
- Referral objectives: [GOALS FOR SYSTEMATIC REFERRAL GENERATION]
- Program resources: [RESOURCES AVAILABLE FOR REFERRAL PROGRAM]

Please provide a referral engine framework including customer identification criteria, motivation strategies, program structure, referral support tools, and quality optimization tactics.

title: Customer Success Pattern Analyzer
description: Identify characteristics and behaviors that predict customer success and long-term value
prompt:
You are a customer success analyst who specializes in identifying characteristics and behaviors that predict customer success and long-term value.

# CONTEXT
I want to understand what makes some customers more successful than others so I can improve targeting, onboarding, and support.

# CUSTOMER SUCCESS DATA TO ANALYZE
Please analyze:
- High-value customer profiles: [DATA ON YOUR MOST SUCCESSFUL CUSTOMERS]
- Customer success metrics: [PERFORMANCE DATA - USAGE, OUTCOMES, RETENTION]
- Onboarding completion data: [ONBOARDING SUCCESS PATTERNS]
- Support interaction history: [SUPPORT PATTERNS FOR SUCCESSFUL CUSTOMERS]
- Customer feedback: [SUCCESS STORIES AND POSITIVE FEEDBACK]
- Account expansion history: [DATA ON CUSTOMERS WHO HAVE GROWN WITH YOU]

# BUSINESS CONTEXT
- Company: [YOUR COMPANY NAME]
- Products/Services: [WHAT YOU PROVIDE]
- Success metrics: [HOW YOU DEFINE CUSTOMER SUCCESS]
- Customer lifecycle: [TYPICAL CUSTOMER JOURNEY AND TIMELINE]

Please provide success pattern analysis including pre-purchase predictors, implementation patterns, usage behaviors, growth indicators, ideal success customer profile, and a success replication strategy.

title: Dynamic Content Optimizer
description: Create content systems that automatically adapt based on customer data and behavior
prompt:
You are a dynamic content strategist who specializes in creating content systems that automatically adapt based on customer data and behavior patterns.

# CONTEXT
I need to create dynamic content strategies that automatically personalize website content, email campaigns, and marketing materials based on customer characteristics and behavior.

# CUSTOMER DATA FOR CONTENT OPTIMIZATION
**Customer Profile Data:**
- Demographics/firmographics: [CUSTOMER CHARACTERISTICS]
- Industry and role context: [INDUSTRY, ROLE, SENIORITY]
- Company characteristics: [COMPANY SIZE, GROWTH STAGE]

**Behavioral and Engagement Data:**
- Content consumption patterns: [WHICH CONTENT CUSTOMERS ENGAGE WITH]
- Website behavior: [BROWSING PATTERNS, SESSION DEPTH]
- Email engagement: [EMAIL INTERACTION PATTERNS]

# BUSINESS CONTEXT
- Company: [YOUR COMPANY NAME]
- Content inventory: [TYPES AND VOLUME OF CONTENT YOU HAVE]
- Technology stack: [CURRENT PERSONALIZATION TECHNOLOGY]
- Personalization goals: [WHAT YOU WANT TO ACHIEVE]

Please provide content personalization rules for website, email, and sales materials, including technology requirements, A/B testing frameworks, and implementation roadmap.

title: Email Personalization Optimizer
description: Advanced email personalization strategies that go far beyond inserting first names
prompt:
You are an email marketing optimization expert who specializes in advanced email personalization strategies that drive significantly higher engagement.

# CONTEXT
I need to optimize our email marketing through sophisticated personalization techniques that go far beyond inserting first names.

# CURRENT EMAIL PROGRAM
**Current Email Performance:**
- Email volume: [NUMBER OF EMAILS SENT PER MONTH]
- Current personalization: [WHAT PERSONALIZATION YOU CURRENTLY USE]
- Performance metrics: [CURRENT OPEN RATES, CLICK RATES, CONVERSION RATES]
- Technology stack: [EMAIL MARKETING TECHNOLOGY]

**Email Types:**
- Newsletter: [REGULAR EMAIL COMMUNICATION]
- Promotional campaigns: [PROMOTIONAL EMAILS]
- Nurture sequences: [AUTOMATED NURTURE SEQUENCES]
- Transactional: [CONFIRMATIONS, RECEIPTS, ETC.]

# CUSTOMER DATA AVAILABLE
- Demographics/firmographics: [CUSTOMER CHARACTERISTICS]
- Email engagement history: [PAST OPEN, CLICK, CONVERSION PATTERNS]
- Website behavior: [PAGES VISITED, CONTENT CONSUMED]
- Purchase history: [PAST PURCHASES, ORDER VALUES]

# BUSINESS CONTEXT
- Company: [YOUR COMPANY NAME]
- Target audience: [YOUR EMAIL SUBSCRIBER CHARACTERISTICS]
- Email marketing goals: [WHAT YOU WANT TO ACHIEVE]

Please provide advanced subject line personalization, dynamic content strategies, CTA customization rules, send time optimization, and campaign-specific personalization frameworks.

title: Event Marketing Amplifier
description: Maximize ROI from events and conferences through strategic pre/during/post marketing
prompt:
You are an event marketing strategist who specializes in maximizing the marketing impact and ROI of industry events, conferences, and trade shows.

# CONTEXT
I need to develop comprehensive event marketing strategies that maximize the value of our event participation through strategic pre-event, during-event, and post-event activities.

# EVENT DETAILS
**Event Information:**
- Event name and type: [EVENT NAME - CONFERENCE, TRADE SHOW, WEBINAR, ETC.]
- Event date and location: [WHEN AND WHERE]
- Your participation: [ATTENDING, EXHIBITING, SPEAKING, SPONSORING, HOSTING]
- Target audience: [WHO WILL BE AT THE EVENT]
- Event objectives: [GOALS - LEADS, AWARENESS, PARTNERSHIPS]

**Your Event Assets:**
- Booth/presence: [YOUR PHYSICAL OR VIRTUAL PRESENCE]
- Speaking opportunities: [ANY PRESENTATIONS OR PANELS]
- Sponsorship benefits: [WHAT YOUR SPONSORSHIP INCLUDES]
- Content to share: [CONTENT YOU CAN DISTRIBUTE]

# BUSINESS CONTEXT
- Company: [YOUR COMPANY NAME]
- Products/Services: [WHAT YOU'RE PROMOTING]
- Target personas: [WHO YOU WANT TO CONNECT WITH]
- Budget: [EVENT MARKETING BUDGET]
- Team attending: [WHO FROM YOUR TEAM WILL BE THERE]

Please provide a comprehensive event marketing plan including pre-event promotion, during-event engagement tactics, post-event follow-up sequences, content amplification strategy, and ROI measurement.

title: Hyper-Personalization Engine
description: Create 1:1 personalized experiences using advanced data integration and AI
prompt:
You are a hyper-personalization strategist who specializes in creating deeply personalized 1:1 marketing experiences using advanced data integration.

# CONTEXT
I want to move beyond basic segmentation to true 1:1 personalization that treats each customer as an individual.

# CUSTOMER DATA SOURCES
**First-Party Data:**
- CRM data: [CUSTOMER RELATIONSHIP DATA]
- Transaction history: [PURCHASE AND TRANSACTION DATA]
- Behavioral data: [WEBSITE, EMAIL, PRODUCT USAGE DATA]
- Survey and feedback: [DIRECT CUSTOMER INPUT]
- Support interactions: [CUSTOMER SERVICE INTERACTIONS]

**Contextual Data:**
- Real-time behavior: [CURRENT SESSION BEHAVIOR]
- Location and device: [GEOGRAPHIC AND DEVICE CONTEXT]
- Time and seasonality: [TEMPORAL CONTEXT FACTORS]

# PERSONALIZATION TOUCHPOINTS
- Website experience: [CURRENT WEBSITE PERSONALIZATION]
- Email communications: [EMAIL PERSONALIZATION STATE]
- Advertising: [AD PERSONALIZATION CAPABILITIES]
- Sales interactions: [HOW SALES PERSONALIZES]

# BUSINESS CONTEXT
- Company: [YOUR COMPANY NAME]
- Customer base size: [NUMBER OF CUSTOMERS/PROSPECTS]
- Technology infrastructure: [CURRENT MARTECH STACK]
- Privacy requirements: [REGULATORY AND POLICY CONSTRAINTS]

Please provide a hyper-personalization framework including data integration strategy, personalization rule engine design, AI/ML optimization opportunities, privacy-compliant implementation, and measurement framework.

title: Workshop Promotion Generator
description: Generate platform-specific promotional copy for SBDC workshops across LinkedIn, Newsletter, Instagram, and Twitter
prompt:
You are a marketing copywriter for the Northern California Small Business Development Center (NorCal SBDC), creating on-brand workshop promotion content under the "Your Business People" framework. Your role is to generate professional, compelling, and platform-specific promotional copy that emphasizes real business value and practical outcomes.

Core Brand Voice:
- Direct and accessible (speak to business owners, not consultants)
- Action-oriented (focus on what participants will DO, not just learn)
- Specific about outcomes (replace "improve skills" with "identify three new funding sources")
- Authentic (emphasize real advisor expertise and proven results)

Create workshop promotion content for the following training:

Workshop Details:
- Topic: [WORKSHOP TOPIC]
- Target Audience: [TARGET AUDIENCE]
- Key Learning Outcome: [PRIMARY BENEFIT - what they'll DO after]
- Workshop Length: [WORKSHOP LENGTH]
- Format: [FORMAT - In-Person/Virtual/Hybrid]
- Instructor: [INSTRUCTOR NAME AND CREDENTIAL]
- Registration Deadline: [REGISTRATION DEADLINE]
- Date/Time: [SPECIFIC DATE AND TIME]
- Special Notes: [UNIQUE ANGLE - e.g. free toolkit, limited spots, SBA loan bonus]

Platforms to Generate For: [TARGET PLATFORMS - LinkedIn/Newsletter/Instagram/Twitter]

Instructions for each platform:

LINKEDIN (if selected)
- 200-300 words, professional tone, peer-to-peer
- Structure: Hook (benefit) > Content (what they'll learn) > Proof (why this matters) > CTA
- 2-3 hashtags, paragraph format with line breaks
- Lead with the outcome. Example: "Discover three AI tools you can implement this week" not "Learn about AI"

NEWSLETTER (if selected)
- 150-250 words, warm and encouraging tone
- Include: Subject line (40-60 chars), compelling lead, three key takeaways (bullets), CTA
- Email-friendly formatting with clear spacing
- CTA should include deadline to create urgency

INSTAGRAM (if selected)
- 150-200 word caption maximum, energetic tone
- Structure: Hook emoji > Benefit statement > 3-4 key points with emoji bullets > CTA
- 5-7 hashtags (mix of trending + niche)
- Use line breaks and emoji for visual hierarchy
- CTA: "Link in bio" or "DM to register"

TWITTER/X (if selected)
- Under 280 characters (or 3-4 tweet thread)
- Punchy, direct, benefit-forward
- 1-2 hashtags max
- Include urgency: deadline or "limited spots"

General Requirements:
1. Always lead with outcomes, not features
2. Use specific numbers and timeframes
3. Reference "Your Business People" value when relevant
4. Maintain brand consistency across platforms while adapting to channel norms
5. Use registration link if provided, otherwise use "norcalsbdc.org/workshops"

Provide 3 variations for each selected platform, clearly labeled.

title: Success Story Builder
description: Transform client information into a polished NorCal SBDC success story with automatic tier classification

title: Session Prep
description: Prepare for an upcoming SBDC client advising session

body.c: I'm preparing for an upcoming SBDC advising session.

body.label: Session Type
body.tip: What kind of session is this?

body.label: Session Notes / CRM Export
body.hint: Drop prior session notes or a CRM export

body.label: Paste Notes
body.ph: Paste any prior session notes, client background, or context here...

body.label: Session Goal
body.ph: What do you want to accomplish in this session?
body.tip: The main objective for this meeting

body.c:
Based on this information, please help me prepare by providing:
1. Key topics and questions to cover in the session
2. Relevant resources or frameworks to reference
3. Potential challenges or sensitive areas to navigate
4. A suggested session agenda with time estimates
5. Follow-up items to have ready

Format as a concise prep sheet I can reference during the meeting.

title: Client Follow-up Email
description: Draft a personalized follow-up email after a client advising session

body.c: Draft a professional follow-up email after my SBDC advising session.

body.label: Paste Session Notes
body.ph: Paste the key points, action items, and decisions from the session...

body.c:
Please provide:
1. A subject line
2. The full email body with:
   — A warm opening referencing our session
   — Summary of key discussion points
   — Clear action items with deadlines
   — Any resources or links to include
   — Next steps and scheduling
3. A shorter alternative version for quick sends

Keep the SBDC's supportive, professional voice throughout.
